description:
A Total Solar Eclipse is coming up on April 8 across North America. Here's how to photograph it.

Here's the equipment I'll be taking to the eclipse (some links are affiliate links):

  - Manfrotto 190X Aluminum Tripod: https://amzn.to/4bI2kVg
  - Manfrotto 128RC Micro Fluid Head: https://amzn.to/3SZ1Bb8
  - Sony Alpha A6600 APS-C Camera: https://amzn.to/48jfoO7
  - Sony 70-350mm F4.5-6.3G OSS Zoom Lens: https://amzn.to/3OKL349
  - 67-82mm step-up ring: https://amzn.to/49Ei7ma
  - Thousand Oaks Optical 6x6 Solar Filter Sheet: https://amzn.to/3OL9nTo
  - Super Glue: https://amzn.to/3OLAPQR

I'll probably take my GoPro and a second tripod, to set it up on the whole scene to remember our reaction to the whole thing.

Some of the resources I mentioned in the video:

  - Great American Eclipse website: https://www.greatamericaneclipse.com
  - NASA's Live 2024 Total Eclipse Coverage: https://science.nasa.gov/eclipses/future-eclipses/eclipse-2024/
  - My experience and photography t
title: How to photograph the 2024 Total Solar eclipse
